slideContent.title: 7. Matrix examples
plain_text: Matrix examples

slideContent.title: Geometric transformations
plain_text: Vector mappings via matrix multiplication
Example: rotation by angle θ
Matrix form of rotation: y = [ [cosθ, -sinθ], [sinθ, cosθ] ] x
Geometric interpretation: applying Ax rotates vector x by θ

slideContent.title: Geometric transformations
plain_text: Representing geometric transformations and mappings of 2-D and 3-D vectors via matrix multiplication y = Ax
Rotation by angle θ as an example of such transformations
Matrix form of a 2D rotation: y = [ [cos θ, -sin θ], [sin θ, cos θ] ] x
Vector depiction of transformation Ax and rotation components
Geometric intuition with example vectors and a simple triangle/diagram

slideContent.title: Selectors
plain_text: Definition of an m × n selector matrix
Each row is a unit vector (transposed)
Matrix A structure with columns as selector vectors
Multiplication by A selects entries of x
Example: the m × 2m matrix A shown
Down-sampling concept: if x is a 2m-vector then y = Ax = (x1, x3, ..., x2m−1)
Other examples: image cropping, permutation, ...

slideContent.title: Selectors
plain_text: Definition of an m × n selector matrix
Each row is a unit vector (transposed)
Multiplication by A selects entries of x
Example: the m × 2m matrix
Applications: extracting samples (down-sampling) and other examples (image cropping, permutation)

slideContent.title: Selectors
plain_text: Definition of an m × n selector matrix
Each row as a unit vector (transposed)
Multiplying by A selects entries of x
Example: the m × 2m matrix
Applications: down-samples, image cropping, permutation
